Photographing Gardens New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Southern Boulevard, the Bronx; (718) 817-8700.
A series of four workshops on photographing gardens and nature will be given on Sundays at 11 a.m., through Aug. 20.

This week's topic will be how to get the best results with your present camera. Topics on the subsequent Sundays, which will add a second workshop at 12:30 or 1 p.m., will include bird photography, close-up images of flowers and photographing water in the gardens.
The workshops are free with admission to the grounds of the garden: $3; students, those 65 and older, $2, children, 2 to 12, $1.
From Toys to Textiles PaineWebber Art Gallery, 1285 Avenue of the Americas (51st Street); (212) 713-2885.

An exhibition of family heirlooms and souvenirs from the collections of the Morris Museum in Morristown, N.J., runs through Sept. 8. The items on display include a 1923 Kewpie doll, an evening gown by Arnold Scaasi, a glass sculpture by Dale Chihuly, a quilt from the early 20th century, a landscape painting by Wolf Kahn and a pair of beaded gauntlets from the late 1800's.
Open Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. No charge.
Larsen Designs LongHouse Reserve, 133 Hands Creek Road, off Cedar Street, East Hampton, N.Y.; (631) 329-3568.

An exhibition of textile designs by Jack Lenor Larsen starts Saturday and runs through Sept. 9. The exhibition will feature hand-woven fabrics, handprint patterns and silk designs from the last 50 years.
Open Wednesdays, from 2 to 5 p.m., and the first and third Saturday of each month. Admission by contribution: $10.
Design Sale R20th Century, 67 Metropolitan Avenue (near Kent Avenue), Brooklyn; (718) 599-4385 or (212) 343-7979.

The furniture company will open its warehouse for a sale of furniture and decorative objects by Florence Knoll, Alvar Aalto, Mies van der Rohe, Pierre Paulin and others today through Wednesday, from noon to 7 p.m. No charge for admission.
A Garden Tour Hofstra Arboretum at Hofstra University, Hempstead Turnpike, near Oak Street; Hempstead, L.I.; (516) 463-6815.

The arboretum will offer a self-guided tour to six private gardens, each of which incorporates a pond or waterfall, in the central Long Island area between Valley Stream and Dix Hills on Aug. 19, from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. A starting location for the tour will be provided when reservations are made. Tickets, which will include a box lunch and a reception at the arboretum, $50; members and those 60 and older, $40.
Garden Talks Old Westbury Gardens, 71 Old Westbury Road, between the Long Island Expressway and Jericho Turnpike; (516) 333-0048.

The gardens will offer talks and tours on Saturdays and Sundays in August (except Aug. 26), at 2 p.m., including topics like tree folklore (Sunday), plants which do well in shady areas (Aug. 12) and using perennials, annuals and bulbs to bring color to late summer gardens (Aug. 27). The programs are free with admission: $10; those 62 and older, $8; children 6 to 12, $6.
On Aug. 13 at 1 p.m., the gardens and the Long Island Daylily Society will have a sale of plants, bulbs and supplies. At 2:30 p.m., a lecture will be given on growing day lilies.
Free with grounds admission of $8; those 62 and older, $6; children 6 to 12, $3.
